reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Room Mate Laura in Madrid was perfect for us. The location could not have been better, we could walk to almost anything and felt very safe. The breakfast was the best we had in all of Spain. Try the tortilla Espana. The room was clean and decorated in a modern way. I especially liked the loft bedroom with its own half bath.
reviews.title: Great location, clean, comfortable, and reasonable in Madrid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay and appreciated the free upgrade from a twin duplex to a superior duplex with two bathrooms without requesting it. Staff really friendly and helpful. Luca on reception recommended an italien restaurant which was really good which was five minutes away on a side street off calle arenal called Anema e core.Choice of english news channels, CNN, sky news, BBC.Location was good as was quiet but two minutes away from the major streets and metro not far also.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Not enough seating and lack of table

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the tall windows in the duplex with electonic blinds which kept out the noise. Airconditioning and opening of windows was also good. There is no tea/coffee facilities.We had bought our own and they opened up a small k itchen for us to use.There was only one chair and could have done with a small table.Corte el ingles across the way with a supermarket which was handy for buying bottles of water etc.Take a copy of your passport if paying by visa as require ID.One shop asked for it the other didn't when we were buying cigarettes.
reviews.title: Beautiful and stylish accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went on the hop and off bus for 2 days which was better value.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to toledo for the day but beware when you go the buy the tickets you need to reserve a seat and only on the train you specify, you cannot change the times. Make sure you leave plenty of time as we were queing for about a hour. You obtain a ticket from the renfe ticket office at atocha station and wait for your number to come up and they wont wait as will call the next number out.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, location, staff, bedroom

likes.liked: — Very clean and very conveniently located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My taste in hotels is eclectic. While I most prefer small places of charm and character like Villa Rosario where we stayed in Ribadesella, I also like larger places of stripped down asceticism like Monumento San Francisco in Compostelo, and even utilitarian places like Vincci Puerto Chico where we stayed in Santander, all on our recent trip to Northern Spain. And I even like super modern, trendy, hip and youthful—which is what this place was.
reviews.title: Hip, trendy place with youthful appeal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s a member of the Room Mate chain which originated in Spain and has expanded rapidly including one of their newest, Grace, in NYC, and another, Waldorf Towers in South Beach, Miami. Madrid has four of them, though at the rate they’re expanding it may be more by the time I post this. The magazine they left in the room said they were building 25 more in the next year.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Laura is located up a hill slightly behind the opera house and it’s the location that’s the most off putting of any aspect of the place. The surroundings seem dodgy and they’re certainly not attractive, and not very clean—of course, neither is a lot of Madrid as I learned from a Sunday morning after experience in the stinky Puerto del Sol.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, Great Price, Perfect Location . . .

likes.liked: — Room design was excellent, two floor loft, two flat screen TVs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Otherwise, it’s a pretty interesting place. You enter up a flight of stairs and most everything is orange—my favorite color. What’s not orange is either black or white. The furnishings don’t appear selected to last but they’re interesting while they remain around.
reviews.title: Fun and Unique Room

likes.liked: — Large, spacious, clean rooms with high ceilings
likes.disliked: — Only one computer with internet available for use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a two story affair, with couch and table and chairs plus main bathroom/shower downstairs and bed with (thankfully) a second mini-bathroom upstairs. Even the stairs themselves are interesting. Each is a half step, alternating the place where you must put your foot from the left to the right—not good for a person like myself with problem ankles and knees who most often ascends, and especially descends, one step at a time, placing both feet on the same riser at once. I told you, didn’t I that this is a trendy, youthful kind of place. Oldies take note. I’m pleased to say I survived all this without mishap, but I admit I’d not knowingly book similar digs again, even for the flaming orange accents.
reviews.title: Well placed hotel excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Room Mate Laura for one night when we arrived in Spain to do a spring tour of Andalucia. It was definitely one of our favorite hotels of the trip! The room was wonderful (if you look at their website it is the one pictured with odd angles but lovely floor to ceiling curtained windows on either side of the bed, the headboard of which is a painting. I had some digitial camera glitches that day so I unfortunately have no photos to share, but those windows are out to the lovely Plaza de las Descalzas. Parking is available at a city lot just across the park - not a bad walk and very convenient to get in and out of (a rarity we were later to learn in our travels)! the staff was very friendly, the bed was very comfy, the breakfast was AMAZING! short walk to Plaza Mayor (where we ate dinner at Las Cuevas de Luis Caldeas - don't miss it!) I love the room mate chain of hotels and can't wait to try the rest of them! My post script about directions: the following morning we asked for directions to leave the town towards Jaen, and the two staff people at the desk couldn't quite decide how to send us. We ended up driving in a circle around Madrid for about an hour before I finally figured it out.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Madrid - just don't ask for directions!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic - the location, rooms, staff, food, services - everything is faultess...
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms are huge, clean, modern and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great hotel, better Staff...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free internet, fruit , breakfast and very reasonably priced mini-bar set this place apart. We've stayed at many hotels and this is the first place whereby we were happy to drink water from the mini-bar at a price of 1.50 euros (1 euro in the supermarkets) - the next place in Europe we stayed charged 6 euros for the same water - so i congratulate the RoomMate chain for being so reasonable.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel!

likes.liked: — Great location, friendly staff, delicious breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great time at Room Mate Laura Hotel! Beautiful hotel and nice people! And the breakfast was delicious!
reviews.title: Great hotel!!
Nice hotel
reviews.text: Very good location, close to Metro, nice staff, breakfast fine but not great. Our room was fairly spacious with modern furniture, flat screen tv (though we didn't watch it). Did smell of cigarettes, but we left 2 balcony doors open, and it cleared out. Had a nice view of the plaza. Also, lucked out getting to see for free a great Durer exhibit at an annex of the Thyssen Museum at the Descalzas Reales Plazas near the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel is not plush by any means, but staff is professional. Don't rate this higher than average because we did not have hot water in the morning so we were glad we were there only one night. Staff at checkout admitted there was a hot water problem that would be addressed but that was it. Think that in an American hotel, they'd be less matter-of-fact.
reviews.title: Love Laura
Great stay at Room Mates Laura.
reviews.text: We stayed at Laura for the weekend and loved it! The rooms are all really quirky and have their own character. My husband and I stayed in the penthouse which consisted of a kitchenette, lounge bedroom and bathroom. Our friends stayed in a duplex which was on two floors and had the same features. The staff are friendly and the best thing is the breakfast. There's loads to choose from and it serves from 8am to 12pm! The hotel is perfectly placed for sightseeing and is only a few minutes walk from Plaza Major. The other hotels were very expensive and whilst this wasn't cheap is was worth every penny.

reviews.title: Love this hotel!
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed out stay at Room Mates Laura on our recent trip to Madrid. The staff were friendly and helpful. I'm sorry I didn't get the name of one particular staff member because he was so nice. I would have liked to let Roommates Hotels know. The hotel was clean, efficient, and attractive. An excellent value in Madrid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel on Tripadvisor & were very pleased with the interior design of the accomodation...such a change from the standard hotel room set up The only negative was the poor lighting at the bedside making it impossible to read at night.The breakfast included was delicious with plenty of variety.
reviews.title: A hotel with a difference

likes.disliked: — Very steep steps up to loft bedroom....poor lighting at bedside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were responsive to all our requests.
reviews.title: Very Chic

likes.liked: — impressive, spacious room and friendly staff

reviews.title: Wonderful time with Laura
reviews.text: Look for these Room Mates in Spain . They are special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel with friendly staff. I only wish I had more time to spend there! I will definitely stay here during my next visit to Madrid.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Went for a long weekend to Madrid with a number of friends. We had responsibility for booking the hotel, and after seeing Laura's website we had to book. We werent disappointed. The hotel is what could be described as 'boutique' and the decor is unusual, but we loved it. All our rooms were generously sized, the couples all had rooms with kitchen facilities, which of course we didnt use with all the bars and restaurants close by. The hotel is very centrally situated, and there was a small amount of noise from people in the street as they returned to their beds, but it wasnt unbearable, and we expected worse in a city centre. The breakfast was included and had a huge selection - we were very impressed as we had not expected so much to be on offer - fresh fruit, cereals, meats and cheeses, and freshly ground coffee. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would use it again should I return to Madrid, I understand there are others in the Room Mate chain and I would definitely consider staying with them in other cities. It was excellent value for money, the staff were very helpful and we even got a weather forecast left daily on our bed to help us plan our outings!
reviews.title: Very good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a fantastic place to spend a weekend!
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing hotel!

likes.disliked: — That we could not stay longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Just got back after 2 nights here with some good friends.
reviews.title: A nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were 2 couples all aged around 30 and we had an absolute blast.
reviews.title: Modern and chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel could not be better. Lots of great bars and restaurants on your door step.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel with great customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are great and very helpful.
reviews.title: Great inner city hotel
a good surprise
reviews.text: Loved the location and the free internet...and the design of couse

reviews.title: Roomate Laura, pricey but worth it
reviews.text: Excellent, honestly. They did exceed our expectations. Amazing room, two bathrooms, delicious breakfast and kind, friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well worth the price.
reviews.title: Very helpfull staff

likes.disliked: — Can be noisy late at night but similar to all city centre hotels

reviews.title: very trendy super stay
reviews.text: Centrally situated.Good size accommodation .Staff very cheerful and helpfull.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: good service
reviews.title: stylish and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Room Mate Laura 02/09/07-06/09/07 and were impressed with the service above all else. We arrived at 9 am and were placed in rooms as soon as they became available, with the assist of Luca. He also spent a significant amount of time giving us heads up on restaurants and other touristy concerns. Rooms were spacious for european standards and while kitchen amenities were lacking they were not necessary since beyond breakfast, which was included in the room price and included breads, meats, cheeses, fruits, cereals, granola, yogurt, milk-including soy milk, tea and coffee, we ate all meals out. Without question we would stay at this hotel again. Oh, and the location was a plus.
reviews.title: Great Service Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Ok, I do still like this hotel and its brother property Room Mate Mario. After staying at both, I think Mario is a bit nicer.
reviews.title: Almost Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the room was relatively spacious, v. clean and comfortable. The design details add a nice touch. The bathroom is the weak point here. There were chips in the tile wall, and paint stains on the floor.
reviews.title: Great Art Deco hotel
Room Mate Laura OK
reviews.text: The cold breakfast buffet is great. Nothing fancy here, but plenty to choose from. The room itself is OK, but I liked the b-fast room at Mario better for the natural light, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, solid value for money. The location is perfect. The staff are super friendly and it beats the pants off the nearest competition for the price (or not).
reviews.title: Good looking Laura

likes.disliked: — Hard beds & lack of information about hotel services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent. 5 min walk to Plaza Mayor, and the metro is only a few minutes walk away. We took the metro from the airport and there is directions on which lines to take etc on the hotel website (which we found very useful). There is also a heap of restaurants close by and the tapas bar nearby was excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for four nights with my girlfriend.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel!

likes.liked: — It's location, modern decor, and the bed was the most comfortable one I slept in during our 2 weeks in Europe!
likes.disliked: — No escalators at metro (not hotels fault).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at Room Mate Laura for a long weekend at the end of June. We had a fantastic time. The hotel was lovely! In fact it was much better than I expected. Our room (202) was a duplex and was roomy, airy, clean and contemporary - decorated in lime green and white. It also had air conditioning.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a fantastic city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a good continental breakfast available from 7 am to 12 noon.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately recommend staying at this hotel, it was in a good location, it was lovely, clean and modern and the staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for the money

likes.disliked: — The lighting in the room was dim.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

likes.liked: — Very modern/trendy but friendly. Great location, very clean, friendly staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Friendly staff
reviews.title: Funky original hotel,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying three nights at the Westin Palace (the final days in our group tour package), we wanted to move to less expensive digs for the last three days on our own in Madrid. We found Room Mate Laura on the web, and read favourable reviews in Trip Advisor, so we booked it online.
reviews.title: Room Mate Laura exactly met our needs

likes.liked: — good value for money, modern & comfortable, good location
likes.disliked: — very steep stairs up to bedroom in loft

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel met our needs very well - central location close to Puerta del Sol; good value for money; quiet, clean, modern and comfortable accommodations (looked like it had been furnished from IKEA). A small kitchen (but no dishes as we were only a short stay). Modern large enough bathroom with a walk-in shower. The bedroom was in an upper loft, up some very steep stairs, so we had to use caution in descending, particularly at night. The breakfast buffet was very good, lots to eat and fresh and tasty, including a warm potato omelette. Staff at reception were very helpful, and let us check our email (free) on a laptop at the counter.
reviews.title: Loved the Laura

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay there again if we're ever back in Madrid.
reviews.title: loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room Mate hotel franchise is taking off around the world and I can see why. Whimsical decorations, interesting room design, friendly staff, what's not to love? We thought our duplex room was fantastic. We were upgraded by Joan who worked nights at the front desk and was just so hilarious, helpful and kind to us. The room layout was very spacious, upstairs/downstairs, two bathrooms, two tvs, automated blackout blinds, great bed. Fantastic. The breakfast was really good as well and served until noon, good for the people who stay out all night which seems to be much of Madrid. The location is near the Metro which is nice, but for being so near the Metro, the hotel is extremely hard to find. Even after staying there a little while it seemed always very confusing to get back to the hotel. There is a laptop on the front desk for guests to use which is nice, though you are standing there with the desk clerks and feel sort of rushed to hurry up and finish. It would be far better to have the computer in another place where one could sit down and not feel so pressured to get off of it. We look forward to going back to Madrid and would definitely stay at one of the Room Mate hotels, perhaps Oscar which is definitely the glamorous sibling of the chain.
reviews.title: Superb hotel - ideal place to stay

likes.liked: — Decor was special - very modern and highly imaginative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Went to Madrid for second time in 3 months with 2 friends and stayed here based on the Trip Advisor reviews. I'm afraid my confidence in Trip Advisor reviewers has been shaken by this hotel as I didn't find it anything like as good as many others. It has some good points but it places far too much emphasis on quirky style but lacks many of the basics I expect of a decent hotel.
reviews.title: All "fur coat and no knickers"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many other reviewers we also had a duplex room, this time on the ground floor, with the bed downstairs. The upstairs space had a ridiculously deep sofa at 90 degrees to the flat screen TV and was frankly a waste of time. The stairs have already been commented on before and I agree with those who feel they are a health and safety hazard.
reviews.title: Room Mate Laura is top notch!!!
Fun place! Great staff!
reviews.text: Good points: nice staff, good location, good bed, good shower, bathroom small but ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad points: 1 key between 3 guests, no additional copies available; pointless upstairs space; no tea/coffee facilities in room or even in hotel except at breakfast time (I know there are lots of places nearby but sometimes you just want to chill out in the hotel or room); only one ironing board for hotel, which was unavailable for hours because another guest had it but reception didn't know/care where it was; uncomfortable chairs in room. There was just nothing that made us want to spend anymore time in the room than was strictly necessary.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great locationl

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary this place falls a long way short of what I consider a 4 star hotel to be, I would say 2 stars would be more appropriate. A little more attention paid to the basics of being a hotel instead of the apparent obsession with vacuous style would serve this hotel very well.
reviews.title: We're in love with Laura

likes.liked: — The spacious duplex with all amenities and very clean
likes.disliked: — Being woken by the convent bells

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: We found the hotel to be very comfortable and in a fantastic location. Not very clearly signposted so keep an eye out. The breakfast was simple but we really enjoyed it. Room was cleaned every single day. Staff were amazing. Really helpful and had great English. Very friendly also. All in all we had a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel just exceeded all my expectations. I would not hestitate to recommend this to anyone staying in the centre of Madrid.
reviews.title: Absolutely Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: Sleek modern and stylish rooms, but with a very warm feel. We stayed in one of the deluxe rooms with space split onto two floors, a bathroom and lounge on the ground, and a ladder leading into the bed area with desk. Plenty of storage space, large sofa, table and chairs, two small balconies looking over Madrids classic back street tapas bars. There is complimentary WiFi internet which is a rarity. You'll also find a comprehensive mini bar, which isn't free - but packs a wide range of alcoholic and soft drinks, snacks, and chocolate.
reviews.title: A perfect location with a great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is freshly prepared every morning downstairs, classic continental breakfast along with some spanish goodies - the usual bread, coffee, fruit, cerials, with cured ham and tortilla.
reviews.title: The Perfect Place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have been to Madrid ten times over the past thirteen years and this is the first hotel that I would unconditionally recommend to friends and family. Although I have stayed in more elegant--and more expensive--hotels in the city, the Room Mate Laura offers a good price (especially if you get a discounted rate for booking well in advance), a perfect location, a friendly staff, large rooms, and a very good breakfast that is included with your stay.
reviews.title: Just fantastic... zero fat just appropriate perfection

likes.disliked: — stairs before the lobby and no help

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this a very nice place to stay during our weekend break in Madrid. The young staff were courteous, helpful and ever smiling during our dealings with them. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean and is in an excellent location for visiting the main tourist venues, most of which can easily be reached on foot. The hotel has an ultra modern decor throughout so expect minmalist chic. The only downside of the stay was getting up and down the terrifyingly steep staircase which split the two floors in our room (room 101). For this reason, if you book a two floor room then beware if you are elderly or infirm. The location is on the nice side of Puerta del Sol Square (we found streets off the other side of the square to be seedy) There is a good range/choice of bars& restaurants in the vicinity. The local restaurants offer excellent value for money with their 'menu del dia'. Madrid is a beautiful city with lots to see and do, however, we hadn't realised that it had become a destination for British stag and hen parties and we observed several incidents of loutish, drunken behaviour that made us ashamed to be identified as British ourselves. Local Spanish young people do not go in for getting drunk and some of the yobbos we saw were making complete idiots of themselves. In one bar we saw a group of young men have to be physically ejected by the staff because of their behaviour as locals and tourists of various nationalities looked on in horror. Avoid any of the 'Irish' pubs at night time as this is the crowd they cater for -stick to proper spanish cafes and bodegas where you will be able to have a quiet drink in civilised company. There are dozens of them tucked away in the side streets. By the way, a little Spanish goes a long way here - any effort will be appreciated.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A very enjoyable weekend at a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Air - con con.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was traveling with my girlfried for two weeks and decided to stay here while in Madrid. We picked this place becuase it had a great write up in the New York Times.
reviews.title: Cool Place Except the Jack Hammer Outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving we were impressed with the lobby, room, and location. It was more than expected. While checking in they also gave us a room upgrade which we thought was awesome at the time.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

likes.liked: — The room-darkening shades, the quiet location
likes.disliked: — the construction that shut down the road in front of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our stay kind of took a downward turn at about 7:00 AM the first morning when we were awoken by jack hammers right outside our window. I understand hotels can't stop construction for guests, but a little warning would have been nice. We also thought it was amuzing that they put us in the room directly above the jack hammer. We questioned whether the room we were given was truely an "upgrade."
reviews.title: Cool and classy yet cheap!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We complained about this situation, but were offered no sympathy or help.
reviews.title: Noisy Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a wonderfully central location and exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Breakfasts are super (the best oranges ever!) and the rooms are spotlessly clean. Very comfortable beds. The price for the central location is the noise, however, which seems to go on throughout the night. And right now they are doing major (and I mean major)roadworks right outside the hotel, and the road-digging starts very early. The rooms are fun and quirky (we were apparently 'upgraded' from a duplex to a 'superior duplex' - does everyone get upgraded?) but the the layout was a bit weird - the 'sitting area' was upstairs, though there were no comfortable chairs or sofa - you had to lounge on what was basically another bed, there were certainly no bathrobes, as promised in the blurb, and yes, there is a kitchenette, but not a spoon or a cup or a plate or a saucepan - so you're a bit limited as to what you can do in it. Small bathroom and not the greatest shower either - one of those that is difficult to get either not too hot or not too cold. Nowhere to hang your coats when you come in from outside (well, unless you totter up the very steep stairs to the cupboard that's located in the 'sitting area'). I hate to be critical because the staff were so wonderful but it just wasn't very comfortable. I'd like to think we'll be back - but I suspect that we won't. (Have just read through some other reviews and we had the same duplex as the guy who stayed in January and said he thought he had the worst room in the hotel - maybe we were just unlucky, too!)
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, clean, modern, very nice breakfast, good location.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really lovely place to stay - well located, very stylish and was more like a hotel than apartment - all the benefits of mini bar, breakfast and bed making.
reviews.title: Chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely try Room Mate hotels again - very impressed.
reviews.title: Very very noisey - poor customer servie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated on a busy one way system and our room was on the corner of 3 roads. Continuous traffic noise day and night with car horns been blown at all hours, then when you finally drop off to sleep the church bells start! Only there for a couple of nights so did not complain until we arrived home(big mistake), all we were offered was a voucher to come back for a free night - rather poke my own eyes out! Apparently it is against customer policy to offer any cash refund as we have already checked out.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Madrid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So my advice to anyone staying is make any complaints while you are there as the customer service department is not interested once you leave.
reviews.title: Sweet little hotel, good location
